Description:
`true`*: Trim extra whitespace from the end of a table cell when a table is formatted.
`false`: Leave whitespace at the end of a table cell when formatting.

`true`*: Format the table each time the cursor is moved to the next/previous cell/row using the plugin’s API.
`false`: Don’t format the table when the cursor is moved.

`true`: Add another row when attempting to jump to the next row using the plugin’s API and the row doesn’t exist.
`false`*: Leave the table when attempting to jump to the next row using the plugin’s API and the row doesn’t exist.

`true`: Add another column when attempting to jump to the next column using the plugin’s API and the column doesn’t exist.
`false`*: Go to the first cell of the next row when attempting to jump to the next column using the plugin’s API and the column doesn’t exist.

`1`*: Use one space as padding at the beginning and end of each cell.
`<n>`: Use `<n>` spaces as cell padding at the beginning and end of each cell.

`1`*: Use one space as padding for the beginning and end of each cell in the separator row (the row beneath the column header row).
`<n>`: Use `<n>` spaces as padding for the beginning and end of each cell in the separator row.

`true`*: Include outer pipes when formatting a table or inserting a new table.
`false`: Do not use outer pipes when formatting a table or inserting a new table.

`true`*: Mimic the cell alignment indicated in the separator row when formatting the table (default to left alignment if alignment is not specified).
`false`: Always visually left-align cell contents when formatting a table, regardless of the alignment specified in the separator row.
